intro: Croton vohibariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar croton, is a species of flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant typically features thick, waxy leaves with a variety of hues, including green, red, and yellow. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable ornamental plant.
